thread.title: 2016 campaign fundraising: How much the candidates have raised
thread.title_full: 2016 campaign fundraising: How much the candidates have raised - POLITICO

author: Glenn Thrush
title: 2016 campaign fundraising: How much the candidates have raised
text:
It's deadline day for presidential campaigns to release their latest fundraising and spending reports, disclosures that could reorder the free-for-all Republican primary. The reports, chronicling the financial position of campaigns from July 1 to Sept. 30, unmask profligate spenders, expose struggling campaigns and determine who's positioned best to blanket the airwaves and staff up in the final months before voting begins in Iowa.
On the Democratic side, the reports will all but cement the contest as a head-to-head match-up between front-runners Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders.
Here's the rundown of the latest tallies, which will be updated as more data is released:
REPUBLICANS
Jeb Bush *
Raised: $13,384,832
Cash on hand: $10,271,229
Ben Carson *
Raised: About $20 million
Ted Cruz *
Raised: $12.2 million
Spent: $7.2 million
Cash on hand: $13.5 million.
Marco Rubio *
Raised: About $6 million
Cash on hand: $10,975,988.78
Carly Fiorina *
Raised: $6.8 million
Spent: $2.2 million
Cash on hand: $5.5 million
Chris Christie *
Raised: $4.2 million
Rand Paul *
Raised: $2.5 million
Cash on hand: $2 million
Bobby Jindal
Raised: $579,438.39
Spent: $832,214.02
Cash on hand: $260,939.01
Still awaiting FEC reports and campaign disclosures from: Donald Trump, Mike Huckabee, John Kasich, Bobby Jindal, Rick Santorum, Lindsey Graham, George Pataki and Jim Gilmore.
DEMOCRATS
Hillary Clinton *
Raised: $28 million
Bernie Sanders *
Raised: $24 million
Still awaiting FEC reports or campaign disclosures from: Martin O'Malley, Jim Webb, Lincoln Chafee and Larry Lessig.
* Based on figures released by campaigns. Will be updated with official FEC figures as they are posted.
